sentences.sContent: My attention wasn’t really on the game.
sentences.sCn: 我的注意力其实不在比赛上。

sentences.sContent: She tried to pay attention to what he was saying.
If you paid more attention in class, you might actually learn something!
sentences.sCn: 要是你上课更认真些，也许能实实在在地学到些东西！

sentences.sContent: Scott sat down at his desk and turned his attention to the file he had in front of him.
sentences.sCn: 斯科特在自己的办公桌前坐下，将注意力转向面前的文件。

sentences.sContent: As a society we need to give more attention to the needs of older people.
sentences.sCn: 生活在同一社会里，我们得更加关注长者的需求。

sentences.sContent: Now he’s gone, I can give you my undivided attention .
sentences.sCn: 现在他已经走了，我可以把全部注意力都放在你身上。

sentences.sContent: This game is fun and is sure to keep the attention of any young student.
sentences.sCn: 这个游戏很有趣，一定能使年幼学生保持注意力。

sentences.sContent: They listened to the speech with close attention .
Attention to detail is essential in this job.
sentences.sCn: 关注细节是这份工作所必需的。

sentences.sContent: During the lecture Sarah’s attention began to wander .
sentences.sCn: 上课时，萨拉开始走神了。

过动症，注意力不足过动症；过度活跃症

trans.tranOther: when you carefully listen to, look at, or think about someone or something
